text: As Boon To Be Wild, six year old keg at Belgium Chimipalooza. Exceptionally strong old lambic with, due to refermentation in the keg, an egg-white, moussy head and misty amberish orange blonde colour. Complex, funky and (as is typical for old lambic) restrained aroma of sour plum, unripe gooseberry, stale sweat, wet wood, old sherry, moldy lemon, sourdough, dry white wine, bitter orange. Soft, complexely estery onset, very fruity, lactic tartness with a thin and subdued lemony edge, gooseberry and green plum flavors, sherryish, soapy wheat and bready barley backbone, soft and creamy mouthfeel, vinous, drying wood in the end with, in spite of the ABV which is huge for a lambic, well-hidden alcohol. Great and impressive lambic in every sense, very noble and artistocratic in its old character and distinguished restraint, glad I got a chance to sample this.

Draught: Served in a taster:
Cloudy orange no head.
Aromas rubber, horseblanket, wood, barnyard, funk...
Flavours of funk, rubber, horse blanket, bittet and tart, some grapes, barnyard, cheese, delicious!
Aftertaste is light tart and bitter with funk wood and lot of farm tones...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, good medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bright yellow with no head. Lime and sour aroma. Dry and champagne mouthfeel. Tart. Not bad. Had this as part of a flight at TAP The Ale Project, in Hong Kong.
Besöjad gyllengul öl med ett mycket lätt vitt skum. Doft av gröna äpplen, syra och lättare funkighet. I smaken tillkommer citrus, vitvinstoner och lite hö.

Keg at Mikkeller Viktoriagade, 30/04/15 as Boon To Be Wild.
Very lightly hazed golden amber with a decent off white cap that retains well.
Nose is wood must, funk, straw, horse blanket, apple core, lemon rind.
Taste comprises grape must, funky tones, tarte citric peel, lemon jus, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a tarte rinse.
Solid lambic, good balance.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: draught Mikkeller Bar Copenhagen Dark orange and pours flat on draft. Lemonade, black tea and pickle juice aromas. Good sour finish. A lot of flavors. Bit a ton of metal, spice, sulphur. Hard to finish the glass.
From tap at Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of sourness, lemon, brett, fruit and fruit.

30th April 2015Bigger Copenhagen bimble with Colin, Ronnie, Reuben and Alex. Mikkeller Vik. Keg. Lightly hazy amber beer, decent pale cream colour head. Palate is light and finely minerally crisp. Immediate wet wood with mild lemon and dried fruits. Wood goes from wet to a little bitter. Dry finish. Clean and hides the abv well.

Aroma and taste is sour citrus fruity, some white grape, some lemon, grass, dry finish.

Pours hazy amber with low white head
Aromas of garden branches, sour green apples, grapes
Taste of green apples, bretta, sour grapes, hints of garden branches
Poured luminous orange with no head. Aroma of sour berries. Light to medium body, flavour is lip puckeringly tart.

Tap at Mikkeller, Victoriagade. Poured a hazy medium amber with little life. The aroma is big acid sour. The flavour is moderate sour with a smooth acidic sour, lemon citrus palate. Light bodies with average carbonation.

Draft at Mikkeller Bar. Pours hazy amber with no head. Aroma of dusty cellar funk, barnyard, peach, light citrus. Flavor is light sweet and light moderate acidic with a super soft balanced palate. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation. Great stuff!

Tap, 2009 vintage @ 4:20, Rome.
Pours clear copper color with a small head. Apricot on the nose, faint alcohol comes through, a bit yeasty. A lot of alcohol on the flavor, apricot, herbs and some grapes. A bit odd and way too boozy.
2254

Draught (9,9%) Brasserie 4:20 as "Boon Foeder #10 09." Aroma is mild with sourish, earthy notes and some grapefruit. Also peaches and mild grain. Flavour has aggressive tartness with grain, alcohol and grapefruit. Not your typical lambic, booze comes through rather well.
Draught at Mikkeller bar Copenhagen. Amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, peach, tart, grass and earthy notes. Sour finish with citrus, tart and grass. Very nice lambic.

Lambic piuttosto maltata. Sapore tipico del lievito autoctono addolcito dalla maltazione che ne fa una birra dal discreto tasso alcolico e dalla buona beva. Netto sentore di sciroppo di sambuco.

floral, cheese, pale, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, fizzy,

Rating #800.
TAP at De Kelk Brugge. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, almost no head.
NOSE: very sour, brett, horse blanket, little sweetness though.
TASTE: flat, sour, bitter aftertaste, brett, hay, grass.
Amazing lambic!

Draft @ kelk 
Pours pretty dark orange 
No foam ( deuh ) 
Smells funky 
Has a little touch of carbo . 
Taste is funky and bald . Nice !

Pours hazy orange. Aroma is honey, funk, white wine, apricot. Taste is honey, funk, apricot, peach, grass. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy dark orange amber with low white head. Aroma of bretta, green grapes, grass, hay and light barnyard. Taste is big tart sour, grapes and unripe apples. Body is crisp and light with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Trappist Provisions. Pretty insane beer. It pours a deep gold with a bubbly off white head. The aroma has deep and complex notes of leather, and tart oranges. The flavor has more aged leather (like grandpas recliner), orange marmalade and big time funk. Not a lot of sour, just leather and funk with some mildly tart orange marmalade. Really fun and awesome stuff.

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy amber with airy white head. Clear, vinous aroma with nearly indiscernible hoppy notes. Rough, vinous flavour with subtle, rough malty notes. Lingering, sour aftertaste. Really good.

Draught at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Hazy amber coloured beer, no carbonation and no head. Very special bread dough yeasty noted aroma with some sour preserved fruits, raisin hinted dry grainy touches. Medium to full palate. Finish is really special, again hints of dough, hay, grainy dry fruity and light sour hinted. Almost like drinking liquid bread. Very strange and special, not sure what to think of this one....

Draught @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours hazy golden with a small offwhite head. Aroma is sour, brett,grapes, dusty, barnyard. Flavor is rather sour with wood, grapes, light lemon, barnyard, brett, dusty. Thin body, lively carbonation, dry acidic finish. 050513
On tap @Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy amber with small white head. Aroma of malt, fruit, wheat, hops and barnyard. Flavor is malty and tart, lemon, wheat and barnyard. Pretty good

[4/30/13] Draught at Mikkeler & Friends in Copenhagen. Murky deep amber. Sour-sweet alcoholic aroma with malt, cherries, vinegar and wood. Sour-sweet flavor with lots of cherries, overripe fruits, oak and a bitter-sour finish with lemony notes. Medium-bodied.

Draught at Mikkeller and Friends cons 2013-05-04 Köpenhamn
AR: kriek
AP: woddy in colour, reddish head
F: krieky, tart, fizzy, great brew
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen, Denmark. Hazy orange, low head. Woody, vinegary, a bit alcoholic. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with firm acidity.

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends.

Dark golden with no head. The aroma was strong, it reminded a bit of white spirit. Also wood, some light berries, vinegar and lemon. The finish was really sour. A bit strange but ok.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar, Stefansgade. No head. Color is golden. Aroma and tasteare brett, stable, lactose acid, malt and notes of sugar.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. The pours hazy deep gold with no head whatsoever. The nose is rotting mashed lemon meat. Plenty of must and acetic tang. Pennies. Light orange candies. The taste is rich wood, lemon. Rind. A bit of sherry spirit. Acetic tang. Nice bitter, clean finish. Light body, still. Drinks well for the ABV. Overall, a nice beer.

Draft at Mikkeller&Friends. Pours an opaque amber-orange. Smells of basement. Tastes sweet, but very sour, borderline puckering but on the right side of the fence. Finishes wet, and sour. Quite an amazing sour.
At De Kelk Bruges, on tap, aged for 3  years. orange colored, no head at all, but a divine, string taste that last and last, beautiful!

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stefans. Hazy amber/orange with tiny white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, tart, hop, wheat and barnyard. Flavour is malt, tart, lemon, little citrus, wheat, little barnyard and medium dry.

Long night at Brasserie 420 during the summer of 2011.  Who says you dont shoot pappy...multiple times.  Review from notes.  Pour is transparent golden amber with tight off white head.  The nose has a light fruit and cheese rind with vinegar and light acetic acid in back.  Taste is earthy with notes of cheese and golden fruits.  Light vinegar and stronger acetic acid in back.  Body is a touch heavy and creamy with low carbonation.
Draught at Mikkeller. Hazy orange. Tart apple aroma with notes of cellar. Tart flavour with plenty of notes of applejuice. Delicious and very drinkable.

12-OCT-2012, draft @Mikkeller, Mortens fødselsdag.
Hazy orange with lasting almost white head.
Tart sour aroma with brett.
Sour taste with orange peel, lemon, brett, and a little bitterness. Some body and soft carbonationen.
This is really a nice sour. Smooth and friendly:-)

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. Cloudy orange with no head. Aroma is brett, horseblanket, wood, wet soil, vinegar, gooseberries, citric notes. Flavor is brett, tart, funk, lemon peel, oaky wood. Vineous. Reminds me a bit of a rough white Jura wine.

Cask @ Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. No carbonation. 240712

@ Antwaerps Bierhuyske 
Head: none 
Colour: gold / apple juicy 
Smell: lemony, bit skunky , slight metalic and bit of paintstriper 
Taste: starts very acidic like vinegar and then blends over in a slightly thin irony taste with some bitterness in the end , actually not bad !

cask / hand-pump @ t Antwaerps Bierhuiske // according to the owner 2 yr old & +/- 9 % ABV base beer for Marriage Parfait Geueze // given that there is no confirmation from the brewer that other higher alcohol old lambics save for this one has been sold by Boon // it was probably this & fits more here than with the 6 % version // clear golden with a very small white head // smell is lots of soap, tat lemon & barnyard funk // tastes like tart lemon, hay, soap, barnyard funk, slightly acid lemon, decent amount of brett // dry, flat & ridiculously drinkable, seriously // not the best ever but certainly interesting

08/04/2012 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Intenso colore ambrato chiaro, lievemente torbido, buona schiuma persistente. Aroma intenso e penetrante di lieviti selvatici, mela, con note citriche. In bocca è acido ma senza eccessi, i 10 gradi alcolici non si sentono per niente, ma ammorbidiscono notevolmente lacidità. In compenso il corpo eccessivo ne compromette la bevibilità. Non è uno dei lambic che preferisco.

Bottle shared in 4:20, Rome. Possibly courtesy of fonefan? It can be very hard to decipher my ramblings. Clear reddish orange with a thin off white head that faded quickly. Aroma has fruit, sugar, floorboards, a bit like someone has shit in the room next door and the smell has just wafted through. Initial smooth fruit is followed up by a a fair chunk of sweet and sour. Not really my kind of beer.

On tap,  hazy light orange, no head, aroma: rotten apples, lacto acid, sulfur, brett, stable, horse blanket, dusty, lemon, vinegar, earthy, dryness, herbal, no carbonation, Taste: fruity, apricot, could do with some more acidity,  farty, a lot of stable, lemon horse blanket, bitterness,  grape, lacto acid, sulfur, very dry,

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2011 On tap. Pours cloudy orange with no head. Aroma is brett, lacto acid, stable, rural notes, vinegar, barnyard, gooseberries, wood, some fruity notes and tartness. Taste is brett, tart, stable, some funky earthy notes, oak, sour berries, feel of alcohol and lemon peel.

Draught at Craft Beer Co, London. Hazy orange brown color. Sweet and fairly sour aroma with grapefruit, orange, raspberry and hint of acetic acid. Thick sweet and sour flavor with grapefruit, citrus pith and hint of acetic acid. Tastes like a thick sweet very full bodied lambic. Great as such but somehow this asks for food, white cheeses for example.

Tap at Craft beer co, this one pours a browny yellow, bit of hazy, the smell is  of the tart sourness of lambics, the taste is pretty standard sourness a bit more sour then I would have liked but overall pretty good stuff
Draught at Craft Beer, London august 2011. Orange with a minimal head. Vinegare, leather, fruity aroma. Sourflavor with grapefruit a bit vinous.
On tap. Poured hazy brown with no head. Light caramel, malty base with big sour, alcoholic finish. Very enjoyable.

August 13, 2011 - draught at Craft Beer Co.  How awesome is it that I got to have this before the keg kicked!  Things were a little hectic when I rated this, but I have to say my lasting impression is ...   MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!  Hazy gold with minimal head.  Aroma is a really nice subtle and balanced sweet generically fruity malt nicely balanced against a funky/yeasty acidic sourness with musty dry oak - yumm.  The taste?  well, 10%?  not to my taste - perfect balance of complex acidity, funky/dusty-dry oak and enough almost syrupy sweet background .... whatever it is .... to keep it from melting my tooth enamel - frickin lovely stuff, I am sad I will never have it again.  Thick, acidic, lively mouthfeel, long dry acidic finish, leaves a buzzing palate and memories of the barrel.  Amazing.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Co, London. Hazy ambery golden colour, small head. Aroma is peach, sour/tart wood, some slight yeasty and earthy notes as well. Flavour is very pleasantly balanced sweet and sour notes with mild fruity and wooden notes. Totally beautiful brew.

Draught at Craft Beer, London. Orange/copper color, almost no head. Leather aroma, vinous, sweetish, rubber notes, fruity grapes, and grapefruit notes. Vinous rubber flavor, sweetish, fruity, sourish, citrus, grapefruit. Very nice and with alcohol very well hidden.

Draught at Craft Beer Co. Orange-amber color, flat and glowing. Lovely nose: grapefruit, yogirt, dust, rich malts, and touch of caramel and all kinds of fruit. Big sweet-and-sour flavor, with yogurt, wood, grapefruit and its zest, apricot, and almost canned peaches. Unbelievably drinkable for 9.9%! Ive never had anything like it, a strong, easy-drinking lambic. Really great. Prefect light carbonation as well.

Tap at MesandSims crazy wedding party & at the Craft Beer Co! It pours clear orange, with no head or carbonation. The nose is farmyard, red apple, strawberry, salt and vinegar. The taste is tart lemon and lime, orange zest, mango, farmyard, eggy tartness, sour Granny Smith apple and pear, with a moderate tart finish. The flavour is very balanced and I still cant believe that this is 10%, it was just so drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2011 Its amazing I remember drinking this because I kept up while Alex actually managed to get Chris hungover drunk. Thanks man! Translucent red-amber, thin white head, small bubbled. Lightly acetic nose brings cherry, also has rubber band brett. Acetic flavor shows some acetone, balsamic cherry, brown sugar. Sticky body, moderate carbonation.
Draft at 4:20, courtesy of Alex - grazie signore!  Hazy golden color, fluffy beige head.  Aroma of dusty grapefruit.  Taste is intense pepper, dust, earth.  Shows its strength.

Boon born to be wild. on tap at mikkeller... Pours a deeper apple  
cidery orange brown pour. Thin flimsy barely just off-white head...  
Aroma of sharp, mostly sour gueuze aroma, somewhat green still and  
fresh... Flavors are sharp and sour, not acidic. Curly akin to a  
sweeter gueuze. Resembles 3fomt straffe winter as a stronger, boozy  
type of lambic. Heavier bodied for a sour given the strength but  
doesnt take away from it overall. Pretty lively carbonation that  
holds up well actually.
8/4/7/4/15

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 Tap at 4:20, Rome. Pours hazy gold with a thick, white head. Sharp, leathery, sour fruit nose. Lightly sweet, heavy grass, leather, hay, some sharp fruits. Light to medium in body with fine carbonation. Tangy, modest sour finish, slight sugars, some wood and leather. Bit of kick. Nice. (4.0)Keg at Mikkeller & Friends - Copenhagen. Still very good stuff. Quite dry, lots of grassy bite. (3.8)

On tap at Mikkeller Bar as Boon to be Wild. Cloudy, deep golden colour. Solid lemony lambik nose, hints of wood as well. Biting dry, woody, hints of talc, lemony flavours. Great to see Boon making some wild stuff, too.

Nose is heavy yeast, barn yard, some sour fruit and later a warm cherry note, feel is medium, carb is fat and heavy, taste is aggressively sour, not.unpleasant, though, sauv blanc bitterness, sweet orange, then quite hravy bitter lemony hops notes

On tap at 4:20 bar in Rome.  Copper with vague haze.  Lasting white head.  Sour characterful aroma.  Really interesting in mouth with a mixture of wood and blue cheese.  Really in teresting and really quite lovely.  Alcohol makes it a little sweet I guess.  But took me ages to drink just because it was interesting.
golden amber color. Hay, leather, apricots and strawberries.  The mouth is very very sour . lots of funk and Brett going on. Apricots, earth and hay. Great sourness.

On tap at The Trappist in Oakland.  Hazy golden-orangish-reddish color with basically no head.  Great funky lambic aroma, earthy and musty with honey and a hint of sweaty -bals. The flavor is excellent.  Funky with a good amount of malty sweetness - but not too much by any means.  The blanket of the horse is evident.  Medium-bodied with minimal carbonation and milder acidity.  A very nice lambic, which even compared well to Cantillon beers.

Draft. Amber beer with a low cream colored head. Tart/sour aroma with malt and light earthiness. Tart/sour flavor with light acetic notes, oak, and light earth. Medium bodied. Tart/sour lingers with light acetic notes, oak, and light malt.

10% Oude lambik? Had to give this one a try. Coming after sampling a couple stellar fruit lambics from Cantillon, the contrast was huge. Very light on carbonation a virtually no head. Deep gold appearance. Sweet aroma  with honey, toffee, and complex Brett fruitiness and dusty bite. Huge body and sweetness for a lambik. There is no mistaking this for less than its strength. The acidity is there with a nice vinous touch, but the body and sweetness (toffee and honey again) almost completely obscure it. Light boon farmyard character sharpening things up but pretty mellow. Smooth stuff overall. Warming in the finish. This is like the barley wine of the lambic family. A true keeping beer.
Clear copper of color. An aroma of earth, horseback, wet dog, sour, weak sweets, wood and oak. A flavor of wood, oak and dry.

Hand tapped on plastic bottle 2 weeks prior to tasting. Boon To Be Wild. Pours a pale golden colour with a small greyish-white head. Brett aroma. Sugary sweet. Notes of horse blanket. Flavour is tart to sour with brett notes. Horse blanket. Dry. Finish is dry, bitter and sour. Overall pretty good, but a bit one-sided. 25.09.10.
Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours an orange color with no head. Has a fruity funky sour horseblanket aroma. Sour tart fruity funky wood flavor. Has a fruity sour tart finish.
Buono al naso, molto interesssante, pero troppo acetilico e fastidioso a lungo andare.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2011 Draught @ Brasserie 4:20 (Rome) - Deep bright amber appearance, intense fruited aroma, apple, citrus, grapefruit. Taste is tart, complex, winey, quite sour, with some wood notes. Medium/full body, honey stiffness. The alcool completely disappears.
Denso, pieno,corposo, legnoso, in bocca letteralmente esplode, di una complessità inimmaginabile. Eccezionale.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, as Boon to be WildHazy amber color, with a distinctive fine perlage. The aroma is very wild indeed, also pervasive, full and fulfilling, moldy cellar, with old timber beams and barrels...The body is strong and quite round, with malt and strong Bretts flavor; there is some residual sweetness, and a light fruity touch; also a very nice vinous touch; the sourness is not aggressive. There is also some alcohol presence, and this is probably the only note out of tune here.

A Mes rate. Tap at the amazing Brasserie 4:20A superb looking straight lambic. Slightly hazy solid gold body with a perfect lick of a white head. This is just about the best straight lambic Ive had. I cant believe its 10%. Its so soft yet punishingly sharp at the same time. My god, I could get messy on this, like really quickly. There is an amazing hit of something that I can only describe as strawberries and cream. Huge kick of aggressive sourness in the initial flavour, a big warm cuddle in the finish. This is a stellar beer. Easy the best from Boon. Looking at the rest of the rates either I am mental or this is much better than it has been elsewhere. Amazing.
Amber with a small white head. Funky barnyard aroma with grass and grapefruit. Sweet funky flavour with some hay notes. Both tart and bitter finish
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours unclear orange with a small creamy off white head. Nose is tart and rubbery. Young lambic. Very tart - - vinegar. Flat carbonation. Super dry and tart end. Good.

Clear medium yellow amber color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate berries, old red berries, old, wood, leather, barnyard, apples notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate acidic with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20100911]
Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma is acidic, leather and barnyard. Flavour is acidic, leather, barnyard, horse blanket and a sweet note.
Light orange pour with no head. Aroma is tart, nice vinegar, grapes, rather one-sided. Taste is tart, dry, oaky character, still rather one-sided.

Handbottled by Theis. Thanks! It pours hazy deep golden with a small white head. The aroma is acidic, ripe fruit, apples and lots of wood. The flavour is wood, dry acidic, light brett and ripe fruit. Nice one!
UPDATED: SEP 29, 2010 Håndtappet at T&Ms. Pours a hazy orange with no head. Sweet and quite bitter. Quite fruity. Also some funghi aromas. Medium bodied. No carbonation. Dry and quite bitter finish.

Draught during sour weekend at Mikkellerbar, b-day present from evil stepdad. Hazy deep orange look with no head. Woody molden sourness in the aroma, Nutty sour flavor with tasrt berries and lots of phenols, too much actually for my liking. Dry alchoholic finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph.
Pours muddy orange with a small, creamy, white film head. Lovely aroma, fruity, light tart, some slight rubber, citric, green apples and light vinousness. Medium carbonation, light and mildly dry palate. Flavour is soft, tart, some apples, light warming. But thats all I feel of the high ABV. Oaky and kinda earthy bitterness. Long, oaky and dry finish. Nice and very easily drinkable.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy orange coloured with a small white head.
Light acidic aroma of barnyard and oak with notes of hops.
Light acidic flavour of barnyard, oak, hops and alcohol.
Tart finish.

clear brown, almost no head.
mild sourish aroma.
flavor is leather, bitter. only faint sourness, more bitter than sour. Tastes good, though.

Handbottle 50 cl. Courtesy of Theis. Pours a pale amber with a slight haze and a tiny rough head. Lightly tart aroma with some vomit off-flavours. Medium body, great Brett notes, wood and honey. Some light acetic astringency. 120910
Draught. Hazy amber colour. Fruitish sour bit sweet aroma. Ok mouthfeel. Pleasant sour fruity bit malty and sweet flavour.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2010 On tap at Mikkeller. 
Pours hazy amber with no head. 
It has a nice aroma dominated by wood, earth and dry grape. 
Flavour is similar with some apple fruitiness and leather to it. 
Pleasant brew but slightly of balance.

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours hazy dark amber/orange with a fully gone head. Aroma is orange fruity and barnyard. Slight acidic. Sweet fruity and slight malty. Dry barnyard and brett from back of the tongue. A bit of hops presence into the finish.

Fad: Samme problem som calvaen, for min smag mangler der karbonering for at gøre det til en god oplevelse. Der er en meget lille smule i denne øl, tilgengæld er smagen en kende mere endimensioneret. Drikbar, bestemt, men hvad bliver alkoholen brugt til. Og giv mig nu en dråbe CO2 :)
Draught @ mikkeller bar.  Orange coloured hazy. No head. Aroma is very cItric and sour. Leathery aand earthy. Subdued sourness. Some citrus and Earth med to full bodied. Dry citric sourness in end
Draught at MikkellerBAR. Cloudy amber - no head. Lots of wood. Nice acid sourness. Berrie notes. Maybe a light bitter hoppy note.
Hazy orange with with a small off white head. Sour aroma with barnyard, leather and wood. Flavor had apples, barnyard, wood, sour berries and leather.

Draft. An unclear dark golden beer with no head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, horseblanket, wood, and grapefruits. The flavor is sweet with an underlying sourness and notes of over ripe fruits, fresh grapefruit, and phenols, laying a thin layer on the tongue. The finish is tart and the grapefruit note lingers.
